222double SurfaceKernel::evalCellSize(long id) const
223{
224
225 // ====================================================================== //
226 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
227 // ====================================================================== //
228
229 // Local variables
230 const Cell *cell_ = &m_cells[id];
231
232 // Counters
233 // none
234
235 // ====================================================================== //
236 // COMPUTE CELL SIZE //
237 // ====================================================================== //
238 if ((cell_->getType() == ElementType::UNDEFINED)
239 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::VERTEX)) return 0.0;
240 if (cell_->getType() == ElementType::LINE) {
241 return evalCellArea(id);
242 }
243 return(sqrt(evalCellArea(id)));
244}
245
254double SurfaceKernel::evalCellArea(long id) const
255{
256 // ====================================================================== //
257 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
258 // ====================================================================== //
259
260 // Local variables
261 const Cell *cell_ = &m_cells[id];
262 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell_->getVertexIds();
263
264 // Counters
265 // none
266
267 // ====================================================================== //
268 // EVALUATE FACET AREA //
269 // ====================================================================== //
270 if ((cell_->getType() == ElementType::UNDEFINED)
271 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::VERTEX)) return 0.0;
272 if (cell_->getType() == ElementType::LINE) {
273 return ( norm2(m_vertices[cellVertexIds[0]].getCoords()
274 - m_vertices[cellVertexIds[1]].getCoords()) );
275 }
276 std::array<double, 3> d1, d2;
277 if (cell_->getType() == ElementType::TRIANGLE) {
278 d1 = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[1]].getCoords() - m_vertices[cellVertexIds[0]].getCoords();
279 d2 = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[2]].getCoords() - m_vertices[cellVertexIds[0]].getCoords();
280 return (0.5*norm2(crossProduct(d1, d2)));
281 }
282 else {
283 int nvert = cellVertexIds.size();
284 double coeff = 0.25;
285 double area = 0.0;
286 for (int i = 0; i < nvert; ++i) {
287 int prevVertex = getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(*cell_, (nvert + i - 1) % nvert);
288 int vertex = getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(*cell_, i);
289 int nextVertex = getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(*cell_, (i + 1) % nvert);
290
291 const std::array<double, 3> &prevVertexCoords = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[prevVertex]].getCoords();
292 const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoords = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[vertex]].getCoords();
293 const std::array<double, 3> &nextVertexCoords = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[nextVertex]].getCoords();
294
295 d1 = nextVertexCoords - vertexCoords;
296 d2 = prevVertexCoords - vertexCoords;
297 area += coeff*norm2(crossProduct(d1, d2));
298 } //next i
299 return(area);
300 }
301}
302
313double SurfaceKernel::evalEdgeLength(long cellId, int edgeId) const
314{
315 // ====================================================================== //
316 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
317 // ====================================================================== //
318
319 // Local variables
320 const Cell &cell = m_cells[cellId];
321 double edge_length;
322
323 // Counters
324 // none
325
326 // ====================================================================== //
327 // COMPUTE MIN EDGE SIZE //
328 // ====================================================================== //
329 switch (cell.getType()) {
330
331 case ElementType::LINE:
332 case ElementType::VERTEX:
333 case ElementType::UNDEFINED:
334 {
335 edge_length = 0.;
336 break;
337 }
338
339 default:
340 {
341 ConstProxyVector<long> faceVertexIds = cell.getFaceVertexIds(edgeId);
342 const Vertex &vertex_0 = m_vertices[faceVertexIds[0]];
343 const Vertex &vertex_1 = m_vertices[faceVertexIds[1]];
344 edge_length = norm2(vertex_0.getCoords() - vertex_1.getCoords());
345 break;
346 }
347
348 }
349
350 return edge_length;
351}
352
363double SurfaceKernel::evalMinEdgeLength(long id, int &edge_id) const
364{
365 // ====================================================================== //
366 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
367 // ====================================================================== //
368
369 // Local variables
370 const Cell *cell_ = &m_cells[id];
371
372 // Counters
373 int i;
374 int n_faces;
375
376 // ====================================================================== //
377 // COMPUTE MIN EDGE SIZE //
378 // ====================================================================== //
379 if ((cell_->getType() == ElementType::LINE)
380 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::VERTEX)
381 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::UNDEFINED)) return 0.0;
382
383 double edge_length = std::numeric_limits<double>::max(), tmp;
384 n_faces = cell_->getFaceCount();
385 for (i = 0; i < n_faces; ++i) {
386 tmp = evalEdgeLength(id, i);
387 if (tmp < edge_length) {
388 edge_length = tmp;
389 edge_id = i;
390 }
391 } //next i
392
393 return(edge_length);
394}
395
406double SurfaceKernel::evalMaxEdgeLength(long id, int &edge_id) const
407{
408 // ====================================================================== //
409 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
410 // ====================================================================== //
411
412 // Local variables
413 const Cell *cell_ = &m_cells[id];
414
415 // Counters
416 int i;
417 int n_faces;
418
419 // ====================================================================== //
420 // COMPUTE MIN EDGE SIZE //
421 // ====================================================================== //
422 if ((cell_->getType() == ElementType::LINE)
423 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::VERTEX)
424 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::UNDEFINED)) return 0.0;
425
426 double edge_length = std::numeric_limits<double>::min(), tmp;
427 n_faces = cell_->getFaceCount();
428 for (i = 0; i < n_faces; ++i) {
429 tmp = evalEdgeLength(id, i);
430 if (tmp > edge_length) {
431 edge_length = tmp;
432 edge_id = i;
433 }
434 } //next i
435
436 return(edge_length);
437}
438
450double SurfaceKernel::evalAngleAtVertex(long id, int vertex) const
451{
452 const Cell &cell = m_cells.at(id);
453 ElementType cellType = cell.getType();
454 if (cellType == ElementType::UNDEFINED) {
455 return 0.;
456 } else if (cellType == ElementType::VERTEX) {
457 return 0.;
458 } else if (cellType == ElementType::LINE) {
459 return BITPIT_PI;
460 }
461
462 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell.getVertexIds();
463 int nCellVertices = cellVertexIds.size();
464
465 int prevVertex = getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(cell, (vertex - 1 + nCellVertices) % nCellVertices);
466 int nextVertex = getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(cell, (vertex + 1) % nCellVertices);
467
468 const std::array<double, 3> &prevVertexCoords = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[prevVertex]].getCoords();
469 const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoords = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[vertex]].getCoords();
470 const std::array<double, 3> &nextVertexCoords = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[nextVertex]].getCoords();
471
472 std::array<double, 3> d1 = prevVertexCoords - vertexCoords;
473 d1 = d1 / norm2(d1);
474
475 std::array<double, 3> d2 = nextVertexCoords - vertexCoords;
476 d2 = d2 / norm2(d2);
477
478 double angle = std::acos(std::min(1., std::max(-1., dotProduct(d1, d2))));
479
480 return angle;
481}
482
492double SurfaceKernel::evalMinAngleAtVertex(long id, int &vertex_id) const
493{
494 // ====================================================================== //
495 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
496 // ====================================================================== //
497
498 // Local variables
499 const Cell *cell_ = &m_cells[id];
500
501 // Counters
502 // none
503
504 // ====================================================================== //
505 // COMPUTE MINIMAL ANGLE //
506 // ====================================================================== //
507 if ((cell_->getType() == ElementType::UNDEFINED)
508 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::VERTEX)
509 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::LINE)) return 0.0;
510
511 double angle = std::numeric_limits<double>::max(), tmp;
512 int n_vert = cell_->getVertexCount();
513 for (int i = 0; i < n_vert; ++i) {
514 tmp = evalAngleAtVertex(id, i);
515 if (tmp < angle) {
516 angle = tmp;
517 vertex_id = i;
518 }
519 } //next i
520
521 return(angle);
522}

533double SurfaceKernel::evalMaxAngleAtVertex(long id, int &vertex_id) const
534{
535 // ====================================================================== //
536 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
537 // ====================================================================== //
538
539 // Local variables
540 const Cell *cell_ = &m_cells[id];
541
542 // Counters
543 // none
544
545 // ====================================================================== //
546 // COMPUTE MINIMAL ANGLE //
547 // ====================================================================== //
548 if ((cell_->getType() == ElementType::UNDEFINED)
549 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::VERTEX)
550 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::LINE)) return 0.0;
551
552 double angle = std::numeric_limits<double>::min(), tmp;
553 int n_vert = cell_->getVertexCount();
554 for (int i = 0; i < n_vert; ++i) {
555 tmp = evalAngleAtVertex(id, i);
556 if (tmp > angle) {
557 angle = tmp;
558 vertex_id = i;
559 }
560 } //next i
561
562 return(angle);
563}
564
575double SurfaceKernel::evalAspectRatio(long id, int &edge_id) const
576{
577 // ====================================================================== //
578 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
579 // ====================================================================== //
580
581 // Local variables
582 const Cell *cell_ = &m_cells[id];
583
584 // Counters
585 // none
586
587 // ====================================================================== //
588 // EVALUATE ASPECT RATIO //
589 // ====================================================================== //
590 if ((cell_->getType() == ElementType::UNDEFINED)
591 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::VERTEX)
592 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::LINE)) return 0.0;
593
594 double l_edge;
595 double m_edge = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
596 double M_edge = std::numeric_limits<double>::min();
597 int nfaces = cell_->getFaceCount();
598 for (int i = 0; i < nfaces; ++i) {
599 l_edge = evalEdgeLength(id, i);
600 if (l_edge < m_edge) {
601 m_edge = l_edge;
602 edge_id = i;
603 }
604 M_edge = std::max(M_edge, l_edge);
605 } //next i
606
607 return (M_edge/m_edge);
608
609}
610
623std::array<double, 3> SurfaceKernel::evalFacetNormal(long id, const std::array<double, 3> &orientation) const
624{
625 // ====================================================================== //
626 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
627 // ====================================================================== //
628
629 // Local variables
630 std::array<double, 3> normal = {{0.0, 0.0, 0.0}};
631 const Cell *cell_ = &m_cells[id];
632 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell_->getVertexIds();
633
634 // Counters
635 // none
636
637 // ====================================================================== //
638 // COMPUTE NORMAL //
639 // ====================================================================== //
640 if ((cell_->getType() == ElementType::UNDEFINED)
641 || (cell_->getType() == ElementType::VERTEX)) return normal;
642
643 if (cell_->getType() == ElementType::LINE) {
644 normal = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[1]].getCoords() - m_vertices[cellVertexIds[0]].getCoords();
645 normal = crossProduct(normal, orientation);
646 }
647
648 if (cell_->getType() == ElementType::TRIANGLE) {
649 std::array<double, 3> d1, d2;
650 d1 = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[1]].getCoords() - m_vertices[cellVertexIds[0]].getCoords();
651 d2 = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[2]].getCoords() - m_vertices[cellVertexIds[0]].getCoords();
652 normal = crossProduct(d1, d2);
653 }
654 else {
655 std::array<double, 3> d1, d2;
656 int i, nvert = cellVertexIds.size();
657 double coeff = 1.0/double(nvert);
658 for (i = 0; i < nvert; ++i) {
659 int prevVertex = getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(*cell_, (nvert + i - 1) % nvert);
660 int vertex = getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(*cell_, i);
661 int nextVertex = getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(*cell_, (i + 1) % nvert);
662
663 const std::array<double, 3> &prevVertexCoords = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[prevVertex]].getCoords();
664 const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoords = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[vertex]].getCoords();
665 const std::array<double, 3> &nextVertexCoords = m_vertices[cellVertexIds[nextVertex]].getCoords();
666
667 d1 = nextVertexCoords - vertexCoords;
668 d2 = prevVertexCoords - vertexCoords;
669 normal += coeff*crossProduct(d1, d2);
670 } //next i
671 }
672 normal = normal/norm2(normal);
673
674 return(normal);
675
676}
677
687std::array<double, 3> SurfaceKernel::evalEdgeNormal(long id, int edge_id) const
688{
689 // ====================================================================== //
690 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
691 // ====================================================================== //
692
693 // Local variables
694 std::array<double, 3> normal = evalFacetNormal(id);
695 const Cell *cell_ = &m_cells[id];
696 int n_adj = cell_->getAdjacencyCount(edge_id);
697 const long *adjacencies = cell_->getAdjacencies(edge_id);
698
699 // ====================================================================== //
700 // COMPUTE EDGE NORMAL //
701 // ====================================================================== //
702 if (n_adj > 0) {
703 for (int i = 0; i < n_adj; ++i) {
704 normal += evalFacetNormal(adjacencies[i]);
705 } //next i
706 normal = normal/norm2(normal);
707 }
708 return(normal);
709}
710
722std::array<double, 3> SurfaceKernel::evalVertexNormal(long id, int vertex) const
723{
724 std::array<double, 3> normal;
725 std::vector<long> vertexNeighs = findCellVertexNeighs(id, vertex);
726 evalVertexNormals(id, vertex, vertexNeighs.size(), vertexNeighs.data(), std::numeric_limits<double>::max(), &normal, nullptr);
727
728 return normal;
729}
730
744std::array<double, 3> SurfaceKernel::evalVertexNormal(long id, int vertex, std::size_t nVertexNeighs, const long *vertexNeighs) const
745{
746 std::array<double, 3> normal;
747 evalVertexNormals(id, vertex, nVertexNeighs, vertexNeighs, std::numeric_limits<double>::max(), &normal, nullptr);
748
749 return normal;
750}

768std::array<double, 3> SurfaceKernel::evalLimitedVertexNormal(long id, int vertex, double limit) const
769{
770 std::array<double, 3> normal;
771 std::vector<long> vertexNeighs = findCellVertexNeighs(id, vertex);
772 evalVertexNormals(id, vertex, vertexNeighs.size(), vertexNeighs.data(), limit, nullptr, &normal);
773
774 return normal;
775}

795std::array<double, 3> SurfaceKernel::evalLimitedVertexNormal(long id, int vertex, std::size_t nVertexNeighs, const long *vertexNeighs, double limit) const
796{
797 std::array<double, 3> normal;
798 evalVertexNormals(id, vertex, nVertexNeighs, vertexNeighs, limit, nullptr, &normal);
799
800 return normal;
801}
802
827void SurfaceKernel::evalVertexNormals(long id, int vertex, std::size_t nVertexNeighs, const long *vertexNeighs, double limit,
828 std::array<double, 3> *unlimitedNormal, std::array<double, 3> *limitedNormal) const
829{
830 // Early return if no calculation is needed
831 if (!unlimitedNormal && !limitedNormal) {
832 return;
833 }
834
835 // Get vertex id
836 const Cell &cell = getCell(id);
837 long vertexId = cell.getVertexId(vertex);
838
839 // Get cell information
840 double cellVertexAngle = evalAngleAtVertex(id, vertex);
841 std::array<double, 3> cellNormal = evalFacetNormal(id);
842
843 // Initialize unlimited normal
844 if (unlimitedNormal) {
845 *unlimitedNormal = cellVertexAngle * cellNormal;
846 }
847
848 // Initialize limited normal
849 if (limitedNormal) {
850 *limitedNormal = cellVertexAngle * cellNormal;
851 }
852
853 // Add contribution of neighbouring cells
854 for (std::size_t i = 0; i < nVertexNeighs; ++i) {
855 // Get neighbour information
856 long neighId = vertexNeighs[i];
857 const Cell &neigh = getCell(neighId);
858 std::array<double, 3> neighNormal = evalFacetNormal(neighId);
859 double neighVertexAngle = evalAngleAtVertex(neighId, neigh.findVertex(vertexId));
860
861 // Add contribution to unlimited normal
862 if (unlimitedNormal) {
863 *unlimitedNormal += neighVertexAngle * neighNormal;
864 }
865
866 // Add contribution to limited normal
867 //
868 // Only the negihbours whose normal has a misalignment less then the
869 // specified limit are considered.
870 if (limitedNormal) {
871 // The argument of the acos function has to be in the range [-1, 1].
872 // Rounding errors may lead to a dot product slightly outside this
873 // range. Since the arguments of the dot product are unit vectors,
874 // we can safetly clamp the dot product result to be between -1 and
875 // 1.
876 double misalignment = std::acos(std::min(1.0, std::max(-1.0, dotProduct(neighNormal, cellNormal))));
877 if (misalignment <= std::abs(limit)) {
878 *limitedNormal += neighVertexAngle * neighNormal;
879 }
880 }
881 }
882
883 // Normalize the unlimited normal
884 if (unlimitedNormal) {
885 *unlimitedNormal /= norm2(*unlimitedNormal);
886 }
887
888 // Normalize the unlimited normal
889 if (limitedNormal) {
890 *limitedNormal /= norm2(*limitedNormal);
891 }
892}
893
899bool SurfaceKernel::isCellOrientationConsistent() const
900{
901 CellConstIterator internalBegin = internalCellConstBegin();
902 CellConstIterator internalEnd = internalCellConstEnd();
903
904 std::size_t nUnprocessed = getInternalCellCount();
905 PiercedStorage<bool> alreadyProcessed(1, &(getCells()));
906 alreadyProcessed.fill(false);
907
908 bool consistent = true;
909 std::vector<std::size_t> processRawList;
910 for (CellConstIterator seedItr = internalBegin; seedItr != internalEnd; ++seedItr) {
911 // Get seed information
912 long seedRawId = seedItr.getRawIndex();
913 if (alreadyProcessed.rawAt(seedRawId)) {
914 continue;
915 }
916
917 // Compare seed orientation with the orientation of its neighbours
918 processRawList.assign(1, seedRawId);
919 while (!processRawList.empty()) {
920 // Get cell to process
921 std::size_t cellRawId = processRawList.back();
922 processRawList.pop_back();
923
924 // Skip cells already processed
925 if (alreadyProcessed.rawAt(cellRawId)) {
926 continue;
927 }
928
929 // Process cell
930 CellConstIterator cellItr = getCells().rawFind(cellRawId);
931 const Cell &cell = *cellItr;
932 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
933 for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; ++face) {
934 int nFaceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount(face);
935 const long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(face);
936 for (int i = 0; i < nFaceAdjacencies; ++i) {
937 // Neighbout information
938 long neighId = faceAdjacencies[i];
939 CellConstIterator neighItr = getCells().find(neighId);
940 const Cell &neigh = getCell(neighId);
941
942 // Check neighbour consistency
943 int neighFace = findAdjoinNeighFace(cell, face, neigh);
944 bool isNeighConsistent = haveSameOrientation(cell, face, neigh, neighFace);
945 if (!isNeighConsistent) {
946 consistent = false;
947 break;
948 }
949
950 // Add neighbour to the process list
951 //
952 // Only internal cells needs to be processed.
953 if (neigh.isInterior()) {
954 std::size_t neighRawId = neighItr.getRawIndex();
955 if (!alreadyProcessed.rawAt(neighRawId)) {
956 processRawList.push_back(neighRawId);
957 }
958 }
959 }
960
961 // Stop processing the cell is the orientation is not consistent
962 if (!consistent) {
963 break;
964 }
965 }
966
967 // Cell processing has been completed
968 alreadyProcessed.rawSet(cellRawId, true);
969 --nUnprocessed;
970 if (nUnprocessed == 0) {
971 break;
972 }
973
974 // Stop processing the patch is the orientation is not consistent
975 if (!consistent) {
976 break;
977 }
978 }
979
980 // Stop processing the patch is the orientation is not consistent
981 if (!consistent) {
982 break;
983 }
984
985 // Check if all cells have been processed
986 if (nUnprocessed == 0) {
987 break;
988 }
989 }
990
991#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
992 // Comunicate consistency flag among the partitions
993 if (isPartitioned()) {
994 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &consistent, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LAND, getCommunicator());
995 }
996#endif
997
998 return consistent;
999}
1000
1012bool SurfaceKernel::adjustCellOrientation()
1013{
1014 // Early return if the patch is empty.
1015 if (empty()) {
1016 return false;
1017 }
1018
1019 // Get the first facet
1020 long firstFacetId = Cell::NULL_ID;
1021 if (getCellCount() > 0) {
1022 firstFacetId = getCells().begin()->getId();
1023 }
1024
1025#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
1026 if (isPartitioned()) {
1027 int patchRank = getRank();
1028
1029 int firstFacetRank = std::numeric_limits<int>::max();
1030 if (firstFacetId >= 0) {
1031 firstFacetRank = patchRank;
1032 }
1033
1034 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &firstFacetRank, 1, MPI_INT, MPI_MIN, getCommunicator());
1035 if (patchRank != firstFacetRank) {
1036 firstFacetId = Cell::NULL_ID;
1037 }
1038 }
1039#endif
1040
1041 // Adjust cell orientation according to the orientation of the first facet
1042 return adjustCellOrientation(firstFacetId);
1043}
1044
1045
1062bool SurfaceKernel::adjustCellOrientation(long seed, bool invert)
1063{
1064#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
1065 // Check if the communications are needed
1066 bool ghostExchangeNeeded = isPartitioned();
1067
1068 // Initialize ghost communications
1069 std::unordered_set<long> flippedCells;
1070 std::unique_ptr<DataCommunicator> ghostCommunicator;
1071 if (ghostExchangeNeeded) {
1072 ghostCommunicator = std::unique_ptr<DataCommunicator>(new DataCommunicator(getCommunicator()));
1073
1074 for (auto &entry : getGhostCellExchangeSources()) {
1075 const int rank = entry.first;
1076 const std::vector<long> &sources = entry.second;
1077 ghostCommunicator->setSend(rank, 2 * sources.size() * sizeof(unsigned char));
1078 }
1079
1080 for (auto &entry : getGhostCellExchangeTargets()) {
1081 const int rank = entry.first;
1082 const std::vector<long> &targets = entry.second;
1083 ghostCommunicator->setRecv(rank, 2 * targets.size() * sizeof(unsigned char));
1084 }
1085 }
1086#endif
1087
1088 // Initialize list of cells to process
1089 std::vector<std::size_t> processRawList;
1090 if (seed != Element::NULL_ID) {
1091 assert(getCells().exists(seed));
1092 processRawList.push_back(getCells().find(seed).getRawIndex());
1093 if (invert) {
1094 flipCellOrientation(seed);
1095#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
1096 if (ghostExchangeNeeded) {
1097 flippedCells.insert(seed);
1098 }
1099#endif
1100 }
1101 }
1102
1103 // Orient the surface
1104 PiercedStorage<bool> alreadyProcessed(1, &(getCells()));
1105 alreadyProcessed.fill(false);
1106
1107 bool orientable = true;
1108 while (true) {
1109 while (!processRawList.empty()) {
1110 // Get cell to process
1111 std::size_t cellRawId = processRawList.back();
1112 processRawList.pop_back();
1113
1114 // Skip cells already processed
1115 if (alreadyProcessed.rawAt(cellRawId)) {
1116 continue;
1117 }
1118
1119 // Process cell
1120 CellConstIterator cellItr = getCells().rawFind(cellRawId);
1121 const Cell &cell = *cellItr;
1122 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
1123 for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; ++face) {
1124 int nFaceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount(face);
1125 const long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(face);
1126 for (int i = 0; i < nFaceAdjacencies; ++i) {
1127 // Neighbout information
1128 long neighId = faceAdjacencies[i];
1129 CellConstIterator neighItr = getCells().find(neighId);
1130 std::size_t neighRawId = neighItr.getRawIndex();
1131 const Cell &neigh = *neighItr;
1132
1133 // Skip ghost neighbours
1134 if (!neigh.isInterior()) {
1135 continue;
1136 }
1137
1138 // Check neighbour orientation
1139 //
1140 // If the neighour has not been processed yet and its orientation
1141 // is wrong we flip the orientation of the facet.If the neighour
1142 // has already been processed and its orientation is wrong the
1143 // surface is not orientable.
1144 int neighFace = findAdjoinNeighFace(cell, face, neigh);
1145 bool isNeighOriented = haveSameOrientation(cell, face, neigh, neighFace);
1146 if (!isNeighOriented) {
1147 if (!alreadyProcessed.rawAt(neighRawId)) {
1148 flipCellOrientation(neighId);
1149#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
1150 if (ghostExchangeNeeded) {
1151 flippedCells.insert(neighId);
1152 }
1153#endif
1154 } else {
1155 orientable = false;
1156 break;
1157 }
1158 }
1159
1160 // Add neighbour to the process list
1161 if (!alreadyProcessed.rawAt(neighRawId)) {
1162 processRawList.push_back(neighRawId);
1163 }
1164 }
1165
1166 // Stop processing the cell if the patch is not orientable
1167 if (!orientable) {
1168 break;
1169 }
1170 }
1171
1172 // Stop processing if the patch is not orientable
1173 if (!orientable) {
1174 break;
1175 }
1176
1177 // Cell processing has been completed
1178 alreadyProcessed.rawSet(cellRawId, true);
1179 }
1180
1181 // If the surface is globally not orientable we can exit
1182#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
1183 if (ghostExchangeNeeded) {
1184 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &orientable, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LAND, getCommunicator());
1185 }
1186#endif
1187
1188 if (!orientable) {
1189 break;
1190 }
1191
1192#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
1193 // Add ghost to the process list
1194 //
1195 // A ghost should be added to the process list if:
1196 // - its orientation was flipped by the owner;
1197 // - it has been processed by the owner but is hass't yet processed by
1198 // the current process.
1199 if (ghostExchangeNeeded) {
1200 // Exchange ghost data
1201 ghostCommunicator->startAllRecvs();
1202
1203 for(auto &entry : getGhostCellExchangeSources()) {
1204 int rank = entry.first;
1205 SendBuffer &buffer = ghostCommunicator->getSendBuffer(rank);
1206 for (long cellId : entry.second) {
1207 std::size_t cellRawId = getCells().find(cellId).getRawIndex();
1208
1209 buffer << static_cast<unsigned char>(alreadyProcessed.rawAt(cellRawId));
1210 if (flippedCells.count(cellId) > 0) {
1211 buffer << static_cast<unsigned char>(1);
1212 } else {
1213 buffer << static_cast<unsigned char>(0);
1214 }
1215 }
1216 ghostCommunicator->startSend(rank);
1217 }
1218
1219 int nPendingRecvs = ghostCommunicator->getRecvCount();
1220 while (nPendingRecvs != 0) {
1221 int rank = ghostCommunicator->waitAnyRecv();
1222 RecvBuffer buffer = ghostCommunicator->getRecvBuffer(rank);
1223
1224 for (long cellId : getGhostCellExchangeTargets(rank)) {
1225 unsigned char processed;
1226 buffer >> processed ;
1227
1228 unsigned char ghostFlipped;
1229 buffer >> ghostFlipped;
1230
1231 if (ghostFlipped == 1 || processed == 1) {
1232 std::size_t cellRawId = getCells().find(cellId).getRawIndex();
1233
1234 if (ghostFlipped == 1) {
1235 flipCellOrientation(cellId);
1236 processRawList.push_back(cellRawId);
1237 alreadyProcessed.rawSet(cellRawId, false);
1238 } else if (processed == 1) {
1239 if (!alreadyProcessed.rawAt(cellRawId)) {
1240 processRawList.push_back(cellRawId);
1241 }
1242 }
1243 }
1244 }
1245
1246 --nPendingRecvs;
1247 }
1248
1249 ghostCommunicator->waitAllSends();
1250
1251 // Clear list of flippedCells cells
1252 flippedCells.clear();
1253 }
1254#endif
1255
1256 // Detect if the orientation is completed
1257 bool completed = processRawList.empty();
1258#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
1259 if (ghostExchangeNeeded) {
1260 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &completed, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LAND, getCommunicator());
1261 }
1262#endif
1263
1264 if (completed) {
1265 break;
1266 }
1267 }
1268
1269 return orientable;
1270}
1271
1293bool SurfaceKernel::haveSameOrientation(const Cell &cell_A, int face_A, const Cell &cell_B, int face_B) const
1294{
1295 //
1296 // Cell information
1297 //
1298 long cellId_A = cell_A.getId();
1299 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds_A = cell_A.getVertexIds();
1300 std::size_t nCellVertices_A = cellVertexIds_A.size();
1301
1302 long cellId_B = cell_B.getId();
1303 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds_B = cell_B.getVertexIds();
1304 std::size_t nCellVertices_B = cellVertexIds_B.size();
1305
1306 assert(cell_A.getDimension() == cell_B.getDimension());
1307 int cellDimension = cell_A.getDimension();
1308 assert(cellDimension < 3);
1309
1310 //
1311 // Check relative orientation using vertices
1312 //
1313
1314 // If the facets share at least two consecutive vertices, it is possible
1315 // to detect relative orientation checking the order in which these two
1316 // vertices appear while traversing the list of vertices of the facets.
1317 // If the vertices appear in the same order, the facets have opposite
1318 // orientation, if the vertices appear in reversed order, the facets have
1319 // the same orientation.
1320 for (std::size_t i = 0; i < nCellVertices_A; ++i) {
1321 long vertexId_A = cellVertexIds_A[getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(cell_A, i)];
1322 for (std::size_t j = 0; j < nCellVertices_B; ++j) {
1323 long vertexId_B = cellVertexIds_B[getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(cell_B, j)];
1324 if (vertexId_A == vertexId_B) {
1325 if (cellDimension == 2) {
1326 long previousVertexId_A = cellVertexIds_A[getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(cell_A, (i - 1 + nCellVertices_A) % nCellVertices_A)];
1327 long previousVertexId_B = cellVertexIds_B[getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(cell_B, (j - 1 + nCellVertices_B) % nCellVertices_B)];
1328
1329 long nextVertexId_A = cellVertexIds_A[getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(cell_A, (i + 1) % nCellVertices_A)];
1330 long nextVertexId_B = cellVertexIds_B[getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(cell_B, (j + 1) % nCellVertices_B)];
1331
1332 if (nextVertexId_A == nextVertexId_B || previousVertexId_A == previousVertexId_B) {
1333 return false;
1334 } else if (nextVertexId_A == previousVertexId_B || previousVertexId_A == nextVertexId_B) {
1335 return true;
1336 }
1337 } else if (cellDimension == 1) {
1338 return (i != j);
1339 } else {
1340 throw std::runtime_error("Unable to identify if the factes has the same orientation.");
1341 }
1342 }
1343 }
1344 }
1345
1346 //
1347 // Check relative orientation using facet normals
1348 //
1349
1350 // The faces doesn't have enough common vertices to check the orientation
1351 // using topological checks, we need a geometric check. Starting from the
1352 // first vertex of the face, we identify three non-collinear vertices and
1353 // we detect their winding. The two facets have the same orientation if
1354 // they have the same winding.
1355 //
1356 // To detect the winding of the vertices, we evaluate the normal of the
1357 // plane defined by the vertices and then we calculate the projection of
1358 // that vector along a direction (called winding direction) which is
1359 // chosen equal for both the cells. The sign of the projection defines
1360 // the winding of the vertices. We don't care if the winding of a single
1361 // cell is clockwise or counter-clockwise, all we care about is if the
1362 // two cells have the same winding.
1363
1364 // Pseudo normal directions
1365 //
1366 // For each face, we identify three non-collinear vertices and we evaluate
1367 // the normal direction of the plane defined by those three vertices.
1368 std::size_t nMaxCellVertices = std::max(nCellVertices_A, nCellVertices_B);
1369 BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(vertexCoordinates, std::array<double BITPIT_COMMA 3>, nMaxCellVertices, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_VERTICES);
1370
1371 ConstProxyVector<int> faceLocalVertexIds_A = cell_A.getFaceLocalVertexIds(face_A);
1372 ConstProxyVector<int> faceLocalVertexIds_B = cell_B.getFaceLocalVertexIds(face_B);
1373
1374 std::array<double, 3> pseudoNormal_A;
1375 std::array<double, 3> pseudoNormal_B;
1376 for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
1377 std::array<double, 3> *pseudoNormal;
1378 long firstFaceVertexLocalId;
1379 std::size_t nCellVertices;
1380 if (i == 0) {
1381 pseudoNormal = &pseudoNormal_A;
1382 firstFaceVertexLocalId = faceLocalVertexIds_A[0];
1383 nCellVertices = nCellVertices_A;
1384 getCellVertexCoordinates(cellId_A, vertexCoordinates);
1385 } else {
1386 pseudoNormal = &pseudoNormal_B;
1387 firstFaceVertexLocalId = faceLocalVertexIds_B[0];
1388 nCellVertices = nCellVertices_B;
1389 getCellVertexCoordinates(cellId_B, vertexCoordinates);
1390 }
1391 assert(nCellVertices >= 3);
1392
1393 const std::array<double, 3> &V_0 = vertexCoordinates[(firstFaceVertexLocalId + 0) % nCellVertices];
1394 const std::array<double, 3> &V_1 = vertexCoordinates[(firstFaceVertexLocalId + 1) % nCellVertices];
1395 for (std::size_t k = 2; k < nCellVertices; ++k) {
1396 const std::array<double, 3> &V_2 = vertexCoordinates[(firstFaceVertexLocalId + k) % nCellVertices];
1397
1398 *pseudoNormal = crossProduct(V_0 - V_1, V_2 - V_1);
1399 if (!utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(norm2(*pseudoNormal), 0.)) {
1400 break;
1401 } else if (k == (nCellVertices - 1)) {
1402 throw std::runtime_error("Unable to identify the non-collinear vertices.");
1403 }
1404 }
1405 }
1406
1407 // Direction for evaluating the winding
1408 //
1409 // This direction has to be the same for both the cells and should not be
1410 // perpendicular to the pseudo normals.
1411 std::array<double, 3> windingDirection = {{0., 0., 1.}};
1412 for (int d = 2; d <= 0; --d) {
1413 windingDirection = {{0., 0., 0.}};
1414 windingDirection[d] = 1.;
1415
1416 double pseudNormalProjection_A = dotProduct(pseudoNormal_A, windingDirection);
1417 double pseudNormalProjection_B = dotProduct(pseudoNormal_B, windingDirection);
1418 if (!utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(pseudNormalProjection_A, 0.) && !utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(pseudNormalProjection_B, 0.)) {
1419 break;
1420 } else if (d == 0) {
1421 throw std::runtime_error("Unable to identify the relative orientation of the cells.");
1422 }
1423 }
1424
1425 // Identify the winding of the cells
1426 int cellWinding_A = (dotProduct(pseudoNormal_A, windingDirection) > 0.);
1427 int cellWinding_B = (dotProduct(pseudoNormal_B, windingDirection) > 0.);
1428
1429 return (cellWinding_A == cellWinding_B);
1430}
1431
1437void SurfaceKernel::flipCellOrientation(long id)
1438{
1439 // Cell information
1440 Cell &cell = getCell(id);
1441
1442 //
1443 // Flip connectivity
1444 //
1445 // In order to flip cell orientation, we need to reverse the order of
1446 // the vertices:
1447 //
1448 // Vertices 0 1 2 3 4
1449 //
1450 // Flipped vertices 4 3 2 1 0
1451 //
1452 // This means we have to invert the connectivity of the cell.
1453 long *connectivity = cell.getConnect();
1454
1455 if (cell.getType() != ElementType::PIXEL) {
1456 int connectBegin = 0;
1457 if (cell.getType() == ElementType::POLYGON) {
1458 ++connectBegin;
1459 }
1460
1461 int nCellVertices = cell.getVertexCount();
1462 for (int i = 0; i < (int) std::floor(nCellVertices / 2); ++i) {
1463 std::swap(connectivity[connectBegin + i], connectivity[connectBegin + nCellVertices - i - 1]);
1464 }
1465 } else {
1466 std::swap(connectivity[0], connectivity[1]);
1467 std::swap(connectivity[2], connectivity[3]);
1468 }
1469
1470 //
1471 // Flip adjacencies and interfaces
1472 //
1473 // Adjacencies and interfaces are associated with the faces of the cells,
1474 // since we have flipped the connectivity we need to flip also adjacencies
1475 // and interfaces.
1476 //
1477 // For two-dimensional elements faces are defined between two vertices:
1478 //
1479 // Vertices 0 1 2 3 4
1480 // Faces 0 1 2 3 4
1481 //
1482 // Flipped vertices 4 3 2 1 0
1483 // Flipped faces 3 2 1 0 4
1484 //
1485 // We have reversed the order of the vertices, this means that we have
1486 // to invert the order of all the faces but the lust one. Pixel elements
1487 // should be handled separately.
1488 //
1489 // For one-dimensional elements faces are defined on the vertices itself:
1490 //
1491 // Vertices 0 1
1492 // Faces 0 1
1493 //
1494 // Flipped vertices 1 0
1495 // Flipped faces 1 0
1496 //
1497 // We have reversed the order of the vertices, this means that we have
1498 // to invert the order of all the faces.
1499 int nCellAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount();
1500 int nCellInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount();
1501 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
1502
1503 FlatVector2D<long> flippedCellAdjacencies;
1504 FlatVector2D<long> flippedCellInterfaces;
1505 flippedCellAdjacencies.reserve(nCellFaces, nCellAdjacencies);
1506 flippedCellInterfaces.reserve(nCellFaces, nCellInterfaces);
1507
1508 if (cell.getType() != ElementType::PIXEL) {
1509 int flipOffset;
1510 if (cell.getDimension() == 1) {
1511 flipOffset = 0;
1512 } else {
1513 flipOffset = 1;
1514 }
1515
1516
1517 for (int i = 0; i < nCellFaces - flipOffset; ++i) {
1518 int nFaceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount(nCellFaces - i - 1 - flipOffset);
1519 const long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(nCellFaces - i - 1 - flipOffset);
1520 flippedCellAdjacencies.pushBack(nFaceAdjacencies, faceAdjacencies);
1521
1522 int nFaceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount(nCellFaces - i - 1 - flipOffset);
1523 const long *faceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaces(nCellFaces - i - 1 - flipOffset);
1524 flippedCellInterfaces.pushBack(nFaceInterfaces, faceInterfaces);
1525 }
1526
1527 if (flipOffset == 1) {
1528 int nLastFaceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount(nCellFaces - 1);
1529 const long *lastFaceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(nCellFaces - 1);
1530 flippedCellAdjacencies.pushBack(nLastFaceAdjacencies, lastFaceAdjacencies);
1531
1532 int nLastFaceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount(nCellFaces - 1);
1533 const long *lastFaceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaces(nCellFaces - 1);
1534 flippedCellInterfaces.pushBack(nLastFaceInterfaces, lastFaceInterfaces);
1535 }
1536 } else {
1537 std::array<int, 4> orderedFaces = {{1, 0, 2, 3}};
1538 for (int face : orderedFaces) {
1539 int nFaceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount(face);
1540 const long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(face);
1541 flippedCellAdjacencies.pushBack(nFaceAdjacencies, faceAdjacencies);
1542
1543 int nFaceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount(face);
1544 const long *faceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaces(face);
1545 flippedCellInterfaces.pushBack(nFaceInterfaces, faceInterfaces);
1546 }
1547 }
1548
1549 // Set flipped adjacencies
1550 if (nCellAdjacencies > 0) {
1551 cell.setAdjacencies(std::move(flippedCellAdjacencies));
1552 }
1553
1554 // Set flipped interfaces
1555 //
1556 // After setting the flipped interfaces, we also need to update the face
1557 // associated with the interfaces.
1558 if (nCellInterfaces > 0) {
1559 cell.setInterfaces(std::move(flippedCellInterfaces));
1560
1561 const long *cellInterfaces = cell.getInterfaces();
1562 int nCellInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount();
1563 for (int i = 0; i < nCellInterfaces; ++i) {
1564 long interfaceId = cellInterfaces[i];
1565 Interface &interface = getInterface(interfaceId);
1566
1567 long owner = interface.getOwner();
1568 if (owner == id) {
1569 int ownerFace = interface.getOwnerFace();
1570 if (ownerFace != nCellFaces - 1) {
1571 ownerFace = nCellFaces - 2 - ownerFace;
1572 interface.setOwner(id, ownerFace);
1573 }
1574 } else {
1575 int neighFace = interface.getNeighFace();
1576 if (neighFace != nCellFaces - 1) {
1577 neighFace = nCellFaces - 2 - neighFace;
1578 interface.setNeigh(id,neighFace);
1579 }
1580 }
1581 }
1582 }
1583}
1584
1591void SurfaceKernel::displayQualityStats(std::ostream& out, unsigned int padding) const
1592{
1593 // ====================================================================== //
1594 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
1595 // ====================================================================== //
1596
1597 // Local variables
1598 std::string indent(padding, ' ');
1599
1600 // Counters
1601 // none
1602
1603 // ====================================================================== //
1604 // DISPLAY STATS //
1605 // ====================================================================== //
1606
1607 // Distribution for aspect ratio ---------------------------------------- //
1608 out << indent << "Aspect ratio distribution ---------------" << std::endl;
1609 {
1610 // Scope variables
1611 long count;
1612 std::vector<double> bins, hist;
1613
1614 // Compute histogram
1615 hist = computeHistogram(&SurfaceKernel::evalAspectRatio, bins, count, 8,
1616 SELECT_TRIANGLE | SELECT_QUAD);
1617
1618 // Display histogram
1619 displayHistogram(count, bins, hist, "AR", out, padding + 2);
1620 }
1621
1622 // Distribution of min. angle ------------------------------------------- //
1623 out << indent << "Min. angle distribution -----------------" << std::endl;
1624 {
1625 // Scope variables
1626 long count;
1627 std::vector<double> bins, hist;
1628
1629 // Compute histogram
1630 hist = computeHistogram(&SurfaceKernel::evalMinAngleAtVertex, bins, count, 8,
1631 SELECT_TRIANGLE | SELECT_QUAD);
1632
1633 // Display histogram
1634 displayHistogram(count, bins, hist, "min. angle", out, padding + 2);
1635 }
1636
1637 // Distribution of min. angle ------------------------------------------- //
1638 out << indent << "Max. angle distribution -----------------" << std::endl;
1639 {
1640 // Scope variables
1641 long count;
1642 std::vector<double> bins, hist;
1643
1644 // Compute histogram
1645 hist = computeHistogram(&SurfaceKernel::evalMaxAngleAtVertex, bins, count, 8,
1646 SELECT_TRIANGLE | SELECT_QUAD);
1647
1648 // Display histogram
1649 displayHistogram(count, bins, hist, "max. angle", out, padding + 2);
1650 }
1651
1652 return;
1653}
1654
1679std::vector<double> SurfaceKernel::computeHistogram(eval_f_ funct_, std::vector<double> &bins, long &count, int n_intervals, unsigned short mask) const
1680{
1681 // ====================================================================== //
1682 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
1683 // ====================================================================== //
1684
1685 // Local variables
1686 double m_, M_;
1687 std::vector<double> hist;
1688
1689 // ====================================================================== //
1690 // BUILD BINS FOR HISTOGRAM //
1691 // ====================================================================== //
1692
1693 // Resize bin data structure
1694 if (bins.size() < 2) {
1695 double db;
1696 bins.resize(n_intervals+1);
1697 m_ = 1.0;
1698 M_ = 3.0;
1699 db = (M_ - m_)/double(n_intervals);
1700 for (int i = 0; i < n_intervals+1; ++i) {
1701 bins[i] = m_ + db * double(i);
1702 } //next i
1703 }
1704 else {
1705 n_intervals = bins.size()-1;
1706 }
1707
1708 // Resize histogram data structure
1709 hist.resize(n_intervals+2, 0.0);
1710
1711 // ====================================================================== //
1712 // COMPUTE HISTOGRAM //
1713 // ====================================================================== //
1714
1715 // Scope variables
1716 long id;
1717 int i;
1718 int dummy;
1719 double ar;
1720
1721 // Compute histogram
1722 count = 0;
1723 for (auto &cell_ : m_cells) {
1724 id = cell_.getId();
1725 if (compareSelectedTypes(mask, cell_.getType())) {
1726 ar = (this->*funct_)(id, dummy);
1727 i = 0;
1728 while ((bins[i] - ar < 1.0e-5) && (i < n_intervals+1)) ++i;
1729 ++hist[i];
1730 ++count;
1731 }
1732 } //next cell_
1733
1734 // Normalize histogram
1735 hist = 100.0 * hist/double(count);
1736
1737 return(hist);
1738}
1739
1750void SurfaceKernel::displayHistogram(
1751 long count,
1752 const std::vector<double> &bins,
1753 const std::vector<double> &hist,
1754 const std::string &stats_name,
1755 std::ostream &out,
1756 unsigned int padding
1757) const {
1758 // ====================================================================== //
1759 // VARIABLES DECLARATION //
1760 // ====================================================================== //
1761
1762 // Local variables
1763 int nbins = bins.size();
1764 size_t n_fill;
1765 std::string indent(padding, ' ');
1766 std::stringstream ss;
1767
1768 // Counters
1769 int i;
1770
1771 // ====================================================================== //
1772 // DISPLAY HISTOGRAM //
1773 // ====================================================================== //
1774
1775 // Set stream properties
1776 ss << std::setprecision(3);
1777
1778 // Display histograms
1779 out << indent << "poll size: " << count << std::endl;
1780 out << indent;
1781 ss << hist[0];
1782 n_fill = ss.str().length();
1783 ss << std::string(std::max(size_t(0), 6 - n_fill), ' ');
1784 out << ss.str() << "%, with " << stats_name << " < ";
1785 ss.str("");
1786 ss << bins[0];
1787 out << ss.str() << std::endl;
1788 ss.str("");
1789 for (i = 0; i < nbins-1; ++i) {
1790 out << indent;
1791 ss << hist[i+1];
1792 n_fill = ss.str().length();
1793 ss << std::string(std::max(size_t(0), 6 - n_fill), ' ');
1794 out << ss.str() << "%, with ";
1795 ss.str("");
1796 ss << bins[i];
1797 n_fill = ss.str().length();
1798 ss << std::string(std::max(size_t(0), 6 - n_fill), ' ');
1799 out << ss.str() << " < " << stats_name << " < ";
1800 ss.str("");
1801 ss << bins[i+1];
1802 out << ss.str() << std::endl;
1803 ss.str("");
1804 } //next i
1805 out << indent;
1806 ss << hist[i+1];
1807 n_fill = ss.str().length();
1808 ss << std::string(std::max(size_t(0), 6 - n_fill), ' ');
1809 out << ss.str() << "%, with ";
1810 ss.str("");
1811 ss << bins[i];
1812 n_fill = ss.str().length();
1813 ss << std::string(std::max(size_t(0), 6 - n_fill), ' ');
1814 out << ss.str() << " < " << stats_name << std::endl;
1815 ss.str("");
1816
1817 return;
1818}
1819
1827bool SurfaceKernel::compareSelectedTypes(unsigned short mask_, ElementType type_) const
1828{
1829 unsigned short masked = m_selectionTypes.at(type_);
1830 return ( (mask_ & masked) == masked );
1831}
1832
1839ConstProxyVector<long> SurfaceKernel::getFacetOrderedVertexIds(const Cell &facet) const
1840{
1841 ConstProxyVector<long> vertexIds = facet.getVertexIds();
1842 if (areFacetVerticesOrdered(facet)) {
1843 return vertexIds;
1844 }
1845
1846 std::size_t nVertices = vertexIds.size();
1847 ConstProxyVector<long> orderedVertexIds(ConstProxyVector<long>::INTERNAL_STORAGE, nVertices);
1848 ConstProxyVector<long>::storage_pointer orderedVertexIdsStorage = orderedVertexIds.storedData();
1849 for (std::size_t k = 0; k < nVertices; ++k) {
1850 int vertex = getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(facet, k);
1851 orderedVertexIdsStorage[k] = vertexIds[vertex];
1852 }
1853
1854 return orderedVertexIds;
1855}
1856
1864bool SurfaceKernel::areFacetVerticesOrdered(const Cell &facet) const
1865{
1866 // Early return for low-dimension elements
1867 if (getDimension() <= 1) {
1868 return true;
1869 }
1870
1871 // Check if vertices are ordered
1872 ElementType facetType = facet.getType();
1873 switch (facetType) {
1874
1875 case (ElementType::POLYGON):
1876 {
1877 return true;
1878 }
1879
1880 default:
1881 {
1882 assert(facetType != ElementType::UNDEFINED);
1883 const Reference2DElementInfo &facetInfo = static_cast<const Reference2DElementInfo &>(facet.getInfo());
1884 return facetInfo.areVerticesCCWOrdered();
1885 }
1886
1887 }
1888}
1889
1899int SurfaceKernel::getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(const Cell &facet, std::size_t n) const
1900{
1901 // Early return for low-dimension elements
1902 if (getDimension() <= 1) {
1903 return n;
1904 }
1905
1906 // Get the request index
1907 ElementType facetType = facet.getType();
1908 switch (facetType) {
1909
1910 case (ElementType::POLYGON):
1911 {
1912 return n;
1913 }
1914
1915 default:
1916 {
1917 assert(facetType != ElementType::UNDEFINED);
1918 const Reference2DElementInfo &facetInfo = static_cast<const Reference2DElementInfo &>(facet.getInfo());
1919 return facetInfo.getCCWOrderedVertex(n);
1920 }
1921
1922 }
1923}
1924
1931ConstProxyVector<long> SurfaceKernel::getFacetOrderedEdgeIds(const Cell &facet) const
1932{
1933 std::size_t nEdges = facet.getFaceCount();
1934 ConstProxyVector<long> orderedEdgeIds(ConstProxyVector<long>::INTERNAL_STORAGE, nEdges);
1935 ConstProxyVector<long>::storage_pointer orderedEdgeIdsStorage = orderedEdgeIds.storedData();
1936 for (std::size_t k = 0; k < nEdges; ++k) {
1937 orderedEdgeIdsStorage[k] = getFacetOrderedLocalEdge(facet, k);
1938 }
1939
1940 return orderedEdgeIds;
1941}
1942
1950bool SurfaceKernel::areFacetEdgesOrdered(const Cell &facet) const
1951{
1952 // Early return for low-dimension elements
1953 if (getDimension() <= 1) {
1954 return true;
1955 }
1956
1957 // Check if edges are ordered
1958 ElementType facetType = facet.getType();
1959 switch (facetType) {
1960
1961 case (ElementType::POLYGON):
1962 {
1963 return true;
1964 }
1965
1966 default:
1967 {
1968 assert(facetType != ElementType::UNDEFINED);
1969 const Reference2DElementInfo &facetInfo = static_cast<const Reference2DElementInfo &>(facet.getInfo());
1970 return facetInfo.areFacesCCWOrdered();
1971 }
1972
1973 }
1974}
